postsData.content:
We often misinterpret the pain in our life to mean it’s time to change our life.

Leave our relationship.

Sell our business.

Work harder.

Have a drink.

Play harder.

What if the pain doesn’t mean something is wrong?

Growth always includes pain.

This is why you need to have advisors that understand your potential and your purpose.

To help you discern what it is you actually need to do, be, or possess to honor this difficult season so you can emerge…

SEASONED.

Let’s Talk:
postsData.commentAdded: Incredible perspective! Embracing pain as a path to growth is essential. Advisors play a crucial role in navigating these challenging seasons. 🌱

postsData.content:
Just had my 'aha moment' with a brilliant banker last week.

She manages a $50mm portfolio.

Knows every client by name.

Understands risk like few do.

But she's tired of making money for someone else.

Here's what stops most bankers from starting their own factoring shop:
→ Operations overhead
→ Software costs
→ Back office headaches
→ Risk management infrastructure

With BRS, you skip all that.

Focus on what you do best:

Building relationships
Finding deals
Growing your brand

We handle everything else.

Your expertise + Our infrastructure = Real wealth building

Want to own your future? DM me.

comments.commentText: Great post! It's inspiring to see bankers like you taking charge of their own future. One thing I would add is that owning your own factoring shop not only allows you to build wealth, but also gives you the freedom to make decisions that align with your values and vision. You can create a culture that fosters trust and transparency with clients, and make a positive impact in your community. With BRS handling the operational side, you can focus on building those relationships and making a difference. Best of luck to you and your future endeavors!

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Empowering bankers to focus on their strengths while we handle the complexities is a game-changer. Excited for the future!

postsData.name:
Keith Sconiers
Keith Sconiers
postsData.content:
According to the Consumer Federation of America (CFA), 49% of realtors sold either no homes or one home in 2024.

Which makes sense with the challenges we’ve witnessed with inflation, interest rates, and inventory.

If you didn’t sell a house last year, it doesn’t mean you should quit and leave the industry.

It doesn’t mean you should be ashamed either.

There are lessons you probably learned in 2024 that will serve you well in your real estate career.

You just need to keep working on yourself, your professional skill set, and your business.

Stay focused on growing.

Get better everyday.

Don’t give up.

Just keep…

GOING.

Let’s Talk:
postsData.commentAdded: Inspiring message! Every setback is a setup for growth. Lets embrace the lessons and keep pushing forward in our careers! 💪🏡

postsData.content:
MAKE 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘂𝗺𝗲 𝗔𝗧𝗦 𝘀𝗰𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝟵𝟱!

Copy and paste these ChatGPT Prompts to write a killer Resume: 

Make your Resume perfect to land your dream job.

---

1. Refine for Impactful Language:

 Prompt: Enhance my resume by refining the language to make my experiences sound more impactful and action-oriented for a [ROLE] position. Here's my resume: [Paste Resume]. Here’s the job description: [ ].

---

2. Customize for the Desired Role:

 Prompt: Adapt my resume to emphasize the skills and experiences that align with the [DESIRED ROLE] role. Here's my resume: [Paste Resume]. Here’s the job description: [Paste Job Description].

---
3. Emphasize Collaboration Skills:

 Prompt: I want to highlight my teamwork and collaboration skills for a [ROLE] role. How can I effectively present them on my resume? Here's my resume: [Paste Resume]. Here’s the job description: [Paste Job Description].

--

4. Highlight Leadership Experience:

 Prompt: Review my resume to better highlight my leadership skills for a [JOB TITLE] role at [COMPANY]. Here's my resume and job description: [Paste Resume] [Paste Job Description].

--

5. Showcase Problem-Solving Abilities:

 Prompt: Review my resume and suggest ways to highlight my problem-solving skills and how they've contributed to my success in previous roles. Here's my resume: [Paste Resume].

--

6. Enhance Visual Presentation:

 Prompt: Provide recommendations on how to improve the visual layout and formatting of my resume to make it more appealing and easy to read. Here's my resume: [Paste Resume].

--

7. Maximize Transferable Skills:

 Prompt: I'm transitioning to a new industry as a [ROLE]. How can I best highlight my transferable skills on my resume to fit this new role? Here's my resume: [Paste Resume]. Here’s the job description: [Paste Job Description].

--

8. Adapt for International Roles:

 Prompt: I’m applying for an international position as a [ROLE]. How can I adjust my resume to highlight my cross-cultural competencies and international experience? [Copy/paste your resume and the job description]

--

9. Emphasize Innovation and Creativity:

 Prompt: Review my resume and suggest ways to showcase my creativity and innovative contributions, particularly for a [JOB TITLE] role at [COMPANY]. Here's my resume: [Paste Resume]. Here’s the job description: [Paste Job Description].

___

 Don’t miss this!

Get my Best Telegram group for job updates and teaching new skills
You can use it for your job Hunt

Get here:

----

 Follow mefor more AI content

comments.commentText: Adapting resumes to highlight collaboration skills sounds like an excellent way to stand out, especially in team-oriented roles

postsData.commentAdded: Great tips for crafting a standout resume! 🌟 Using AI prompts can truly elevate your application and boost your ATS score!

postsData.name:
Manuj Aggarwal
Manuj Aggarwal
postsData.content:
DeepSeek R1: Breakthrough or blind spot? 

Read this before you decide.

AI is moving faster than ever, and it’s easy to feel overwhelmed by the constant stream of new models, big claims, and shifting narratives.

Right now, DeepSeek R1 from China is making waves.

Some are calling it a game-changer.

Others are raising eyebrows.

So what’s the truth?

A brand-new Red Teaming Report from EnkryptAI - a leading AI security firm - reveals some surprising facts:

️ DeepSeek R1 shows more bias than Claude-3 Opus
️ It’s 4x more vulnerable to generating insecure code than OpenAI’s o1
️ Security & ethics gaps could create unexpected risks

If you’re an entrepreneur, executive, or AI leader, this isn’t just another AI launch.

This is about making the right choices in a rapidly changing landscape.

I’ve spent over 20 years in AI,

working with Fortune 500 companies and AI pioneers

I’ve seen trends come and go.

The ones who win?

They’re the ones who stay informed, ask better questions, and don’t follow hype blindly.

Want the full Red Teaming Report from EnkryptAI?

Drop an "AI" in the comments, and I’ll send it over.

Let’s cut through the noise and focus on real intelligence

- not just artificial.

comments.commentText:
Rethink the AI Hype

DeepSeek R1's buzz is intriguing, but let's not get swept away.

The EnkryptAI report highlights real concerns.

In storytelling, clarity and authenticity are key—same goes for AI.

Understanding the narrative behind these technologies helps us make informed decisions.

Let's focus on the story these AI models tell and how they impact our strategies.

What story will you tell with AI?

postsData.commentAdded: Insightful post! Its crucial to assess AI advancements critically. Looking forward to seeing how DeepSeek R1 evolves in the landscape. #AI

postsData.content:
"If price is your only factor, we might not be a fit."

As someone who's been in sales for 40+ years, I can't count how many times I've had to have this exact conversation.

Here's what every business owner needs to hear:

• The cheapest option usually costs more long-term
• Good results require proper investment
• Real value isn't about the lowest price

In both sales and marketing, if you're competing on price alone, you're already losing.

 Tag someone who needs to hear this.
postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Investing in quality pays off in the long run. Value should always outweigh price. Thanks for this reminder!

postsData.name:
Keith Sconiers
Keith Sconiers
postsData.content:
Your dream isn’t within your current zip code.

You have to travel.

Be willing to do things you don’t want to do.

Meet strangers.

Sell.

Risk rejection.

Change.

Meet more strangers.

Until they become colleagues.

Networking when you’d rather sit at home.

Doing things you don’t like doing so you can earn the right to do what you want to do.

There isn’t an easy way forward.

No middle ground.

Enduring the pain of the process.

We will either go all in on living our purpose or we won’t.

Go all…

IN.

Let’s Talk:

postsData.name:
Jeff Winter
Jeff Winter
postsData.content:
Industry 3.0 automated the '𝐰𝐡𝐚𝐭'; Industry 4.0 deciphers the '𝐰𝐡𝐲.'

The first industrial revolution, which is often referred to as “THE” Industrial Revolution, is actually just the first of four revolutions so far:
• 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐅𝐢𝐫𝐬𝐭 𝐈𝐧𝐝𝐮𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐚𝐥 𝐑𝐞𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 moved from manual to mechanical by harnessing steam and water power, replacing raw muscle.
• 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐒𝐞𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐝 𝐈𝐧𝐝𝐮𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐚𝐥 𝐑𝐞𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 took advantage of electricity, the combustion engine, and the assembly line to generate mass production.
• 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐓𝐡𝐢𝐫𝐝 𝐈𝐧𝐝𝐮𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐚𝐥 𝐑𝐞𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 took off using electronics and software, the most iconic example of these two coming together being the computer - and the Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) in the industrial setting. Coupled with the internet, this gave rise to an era of digitization and automation.
• 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐅𝐨𝐮𝐫𝐭𝐡 𝐈𝐧𝐝𝐮𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐚𝐥 𝐑𝐞𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 describes what is happening right now - the era we are living in. The physical world, the digital world, and the virtual world are colliding together, creating smart products, smart factories, and entirely new business models. This revolution has been primarily driven by 𝐜𝐲𝐛𝐞𝐫-𝐩𝐡𝐲𝐬𝐢𝐜𝐚𝐥 𝐬𝐲𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐦𝐬, 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐈𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐧𝐞𝐭 𝐨𝐟 𝐓𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐬 (𝐈𝐨𝐓), 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐀𝐫𝐭𝐢𝐟𝐢𝐜𝐢𝐚𝐥 𝐈𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐠𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞 to create a highly intelligent, integrated, and automated manufacturing ecosystem that spans far beyond the traditional “factory floor.”

Industry 4.0 is not merely a matter of connecting machines and products through the Internet. 𝐈𝐭’𝐬 𝐚 𝐩𝐚𝐫𝐚𝐝𝐢𝐠𝐦 𝐬𝐡𝐢𝐟𝐭 in how we organize, manage, and approach business. As a society, we are starting to feel the impacts of Industry 4.0 already. Not only are companies investing at record levels, but also governments around the world have been pouring money into this idea as the way of the future.

The concepts inspired by Industry 4.0 boil down to 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐡𝐚𝐫𝐧𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐚 𝐭𝐫𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐝𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐚𝐦𝐨𝐮𝐧𝐭 𝐨𝐟 𝐝𝐚𝐭𝐚 𝐭𝐨 𝐦𝐚𝐤𝐞 𝐛𝐞𝐭𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐞𝐜𝐢𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬, and telling business leaders what to do and when to do it. The companies winning today aren’t just the ones who collect the most data, but the ones who can make that data think for them.

So the real question is: Are you still automating, or have you started thinking?

𝐃𝐞𝐞𝐩𝐞𝐫 𝐃𝐢𝐯𝐞:

*******************************************
• Visitfor access to all my content and to stay current on Industry 4.0 and other cool tech trends
• Ring the  for notifications!

comments.commentText: I believe that there will be a long journey towards digital transformation. There are companies that only use data for KPI and/or OEE. It is something, but not enough. Others store a lot of data from historians and use it only for “problem solving” or “searching for the root cause of the problem” when something goes wrong. A tremendous amount of data, such as paper records, remains undigitized. Therefore, storing, integrating different types of data, analyzing data to obtain predictions and prescriptions to support decision making is the real challenge.

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Embracing the why of Industry 4.0 is key to driving innovation and making data-driven decisions. Lets dive deeper!

Most companies are common;
 What does “common” mean?
a company that has no EBITDA
a company that hires based upon “experience”
a company that creates a fraternity or sorority instead of a profitable business
Leadership that allows toxic and negative people to stay in the company
Leadership that allows office politics to take hold

Uncommon business is;

Your skills can open doors, but your behavior determines how long you stay inside.


Bold Opinion:-
Talent may set you apart, but your behavior is what truly makes you stand out.

I once met two equally skilled professionals. One was respected for their kindness and integrity, the other struggled due to their attitude. It was a reminder that behavior shapes success. Here’s how to refine yours:

1. Be respectful, always. How you treat others matters.


2. Stay humble. Growth comes from learning.


3. Communicate with empathy. Understand before reacting.


4. Lead with integrity. Trust is earned, not given.

What behavior do you think defines true success?

postsData.name:
Samantha Smith
Samantha Smith
postsData.content:
How Hayley Rhode Bieber's brand Rhode is making you hungry for skincare 

If you’ve seen Rhode’s recent marketing campaigns, you’ve likely caught yourself craving skincare the same way you might crave a freshly baked croissant or a drizzle of honey on toast.

That’s the magic of sensory marketing, and Rhode absolutely nails it.

Using the five senses: sight, touch, taste, smell, and sound, brands like Rhode don't just simply showcase a product; they create an experience.

By pairing their skincare with visually delicious foods like syrup-drenched toast, ice cream swirls, and cinnamon buns, they bring the texture, ingredients, and even the "flavour" of their products to life.

Here’s why sensory marketing works so well:

→ It taps into emotional responses. Our senses are directly tied to how we feel. Visuals of warm, comforting foods trigger nostalgia and positive emotions.

→ It bridges the gap for online-only products. You can’t physically touch, smell, or try products online, but Rhode uses creative direction to show you exactly how their products might feel, smell, or even taste.

→ It makes products memorable. The association of a lip tint with honeyed toast or a balm with cinnamon buns sticks in your mind long after you’ve scrolled past.

These aren’t just pretty visuals; they’re storytelling tools that help customers connect with the product on a sensory level.

In a world where many products are available exclusively online, sensory marketing can bridge the gap between digital screens and real-world experiences.

What do you think about this trend of pairing skincare or fashion with food?

comments.commentText: Such a smart way to be different from the crowd! Definitely catches your eye
Kirstie Cameron and makes you hungryyyy!
Kirstie Cameron She’s definitely not the first to do it, but it is nice to see!
Such a fascinating topic. Sensory marketing adds such a unique layer to brand experiences
Nikki Davey doesn't it! Such a simple but effective way to incorporate sensory marketing

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely love this approach! Sensory marketing not only creates memorable experiences but also deepens emotional connections with the brand. 🍰✨

postsData.name:
Cristina Grancea
Cristina Grancea
postsData.content:
Your boss isn’t a friend.

Work is NOT a family.

(Image credits: Adam Grant. Worth checking him out if you haven’t already.)

We’ve all heard it before:

"We’re like a family here."

But let’s be real:

Families don’t fire their kids for low performance.
Families don’t furlough their loved ones when times are tough.

So why pretend workplaces are families?

What if we built something better instead?
What if we created supportive communities instead?

A place where:

↳ People bond over shared values and purpose.
↳ Every voice matters, and empathy shapes decisions.
↳ You’re valued not just for your work, but for who you are.

When people feel connected and respected, they show up differently:

→ Ideas take shape.
→ Teams grow stronger.
→ Results speak for themselves.

If we want workplaces where people truly belong, we need to let go of outdated metaphors.

And build a future rooted in community.

We are better together. ️

- - -

P.S. Do you agree - should workplaces stop calling themselves families?

️ Repost to help others in your network
 Followfor more content like this.

comments.commentText: Absolutely Cristina. When people feel connected by shared values and respect, they’re not just working; they’re contributing to something meaningful, and that’s where real growth happens.
comments.userName: Damesha Craig, Leadership Coach and Startup Advisor

comments.commentText: Damesha, totally. When people feel valued it sparks true growth and impact.

Cristina, I love how you emphasize creating supportive communities at work rather than pretending it's like a family. It's such an important distinction that can help foster genuine connection and growth. As many job seekers might resonate with the importance of work culture, I’d suggest trying. I often recommend it for anyone looking for their next job, and it’s already helped a few people in my network land great offers.

Jean. Glad you like it. 

Thanks for the recommendation. Sounds like a great tool for job seekers.

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Creating a true community at work fosters trust and innovation. Lets focus on connection, not comparisons! #WorkplaceCulture

postsData.content:
Last summer Lucas Wilson and I were reflecting on our first few months at Signpost and brainstorming how we can solve for some of the problems we'd encountered our sales and CS teams facing.

The big three being:

1- Balancing margins while trying to have an affordable offering overworked SMBs could afford
2- Simplifying and streamlining our onboarding process
3- Our receptionist's team speed to answer.

We talked about AI and how/where we could use it to solve for some of these.

Fast forward 6 months later and today we launched a solution!AI Voice Receptionist is now available. This product is:

Affordable - $75/mo gets you 50 minutes and the message hub that not only allows you to see/manage your calls but also makes it easy to teach and train the AI receptionist.

100% self-serve - users can sign up and start forwarding calls in 10 minutes or less.

Guarantees all calls are answered in 2 rings - this allows businesses to confidently invest in marketing knowing they won't have to pay for leads they miss.

It takes an extremely dedicated and maniacally focused team to make this happen and I can't wait to share more later this week about how each of these guys brought our dream into a reality.you are our dream team and we couldn't have done any of this without you all!

If you'd like to learn more, or even better start building your AI Voice receptionist, visit

postsData.name:
Fatou Seck Mathon
Fatou Seck Mathon
postsData.content:
Losing your job doesn’t make you worthless. 

A layoff, a toxic workplace, or a big failure shakes your self-confidence.

You question yourself, doubting your abilities and feeling stuck.

I have been there.

But confidence isn't something you wait to feel again.

Take these actions to rebuild it, one step at a time.

 Reframe the setback.
↳ This wasn't the end of your story; it's part of your growth.
↳ Write down 3 lessons you've learned from this experience.

 Change the narrative in your head.
↳ Catch yourself when self-doubt creeps in.
↳ Replace negative with positive self-talk.

 Reconnect with what makes you feel strong.
↳ What activity used to bring you joy? Start doing it again.
↳ Small wins build momentum; celebrate them.

 Surround yourself with the right people.
↳ Spend time with those who uplift you.
↳ Distance yourself from those who feed your doubts.

 Take action before you feel ready.
↳ Confidence follows action, not the other way around.
↳ Start small, send that email, make that call, and take that step.

Confidence isn't about never falling.

It's about knowing you can rise again.

What's one thing you do daily to protect your self-confidence?

Repost to help someone rebuild their confidence.
Followfor more.

comments.commentText: Love this Fatou Seck. Losing a job is just a detour in the path to your next chapter.
comments.userName: Damesha Craig, Leadership Coach and Startup Advisor

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Reframing setbacks is crucial for growth. I love the idea of celebrating small wins—its transformative! How do you celebrate yours?

postsData.name:
Megan Lieu
Megan Lieu
postsData.content:
My best friend of 15 years told me she didn’t think we were compatible and shouldn’t be friends anymore, and it shattered me.

Over the years, losing that friendship became my worst fear, because subconsciously I knew she was slowly pulling away.

Adulthood had made us grow in different directions, and the tighter I tried to hold onto the past, the more it pushed her away.

That insecurity bled into my other friendships and relationships, where I felt like I could never be myself and always had to DO MORE to get peoples’ approval.

At one point in every single one of my friendships, I have thought to myself “Maybe they secretly hate me.”

This particular friendship taught me that I had developed a crippling phobia of being disliked.

Losing that friendship taught me that being disliked is actually NOT the worst thing in the world.

What’s worse is pretending to be somebody you’re not in front of someone who is supposed to accept you and love you unconditionally.

But when your intentions are true, you don’t lose anyone. They lose you.

️ Reshare this for someone who needs to hear this!

comments.commentText: Friendly reminder that losing things you once held near and dear can be a beautiful learning experience!
Be you and the right people will always find their way back to you :)
Jean Kang and the wrong people will drop off

postsData.commentAdded: Thank you for sharing such a powerful reflection. Embracing authenticity is key to meaningful connections. Your journey inspires us all!

postsData.name:
Michael Kainatsky
Michael Kainatsky
postsData.content:
Do you think you have a great network on LinkedIn?


Many people seem to believe so.

People collect connections, but don’t build relationships.

That’s why you have to focus on building your community.

To take advantage of the most valuable capital in the world.

Relationship capital.

How do you make one call and raise a million dollars?

Relationship capital.

How do you solve a problem quickly without paying consultants?

Relationship capital.

How do you hire a Chief Revenue Officer without paying a recruiter?

Relationship capital.

How do you get priority spots on a TV show?

Relationship capital.

None of these are anecdotes.

They’re just a few of the things that have happened in the last six months

Within our community.

Like-minded people that are all there for the same reasons.

To give more than they care to receive

AND

To build real relationships.

It really is that S.I.M.P.L.E.

Yours truthfully,

I believe relationship capital is the most valuable asset we can build. 

How did people do business for hundreds of years before social media? Relationships️

And lets remember - we are relational beings. Meaningful relationships and a sense of community are fundamental human needs, and serve to enrich ALL aspects of our life

Laura the majority of people that are under 30 dont realize that things were done before social, We had typewriters, not ghostwriters. We had pagers, not iphones, we had friends, not followers. Shit needs to get back to that.
Michael Kainatsky For real. The 80’s & 90’s were the best
Well said Michael. Relationship capital supercedes any form of networking. Relationships are built on trust with mutual exchange.
Curtis can be built on giving without any expectations of reciprocity.

postsData.name:
Graham Nicholls

postsData.content:
The World Lied to Us About Coaching.

They said you need:

A psychology degree.

10+ years of experience.

Expensive certifications that cost thousands.

But the truth?

Coaching isn't about titles.

It's about skills.

It's about transformation.

It's about knowing how to help people change their lives.

The best coaches in the world?

• Master human behavior.
• Understand how thoughts shape actions.
• Know how to ask the right questions at the right time.

And that's a skill anyone can learn—with the right training.

That's why I created my Coaching Course Bundles.

High-quality coaching education without the ridiculous price tag.

Inside, you'll learn:

Strategic Life Coaching – The blueprint for deep, lasting change.

NLP & CBT Techniques – Rewire thought patterns for powerful breakthroughs.

The Psychology of Transformation – Understand what really drives people.

No fluff. No overpriced theory.

Just real coaching skills that work.

Coaching isn't about waiting for permission.

It's about learning, applying, and transforming lives.

Want to get started?

Drop a comment or DM me for the details.

Do you think coaching should be overpriced or made accessible to anyone?

Follow mefor more and remember to subscribe to my LinkedIn Newsletter "Unlocking Potential" - The link is in my bio.

comments.commentText: Coaching is about impact, not credentials. While formal education can add value, the real differentiator is the ability to facilitate transformation through insight, strategy, and the right questions. The best results come from those who master human behavior and adaptability rather than just accumulating certifications
Nerea Arregui Exposito I couldn't agree more with what you have said. Coaching is about impact. Thank you

postsData.content:
Listen to Dr. Monika Negi, Assistant Professor at Kukreja Institute of Teacher Education, as she shares her experience with EdIndia’s teacher education program in Uttarakhand.

She talks about how our workshops, digital resources, and webinars have supported pre-service teachers over the last two years, helping them build their skills. Dr. Negi also stresses the need to continue these efforts to further support the development of future educators.

Learn more:



||||||||||

postsData.commentAdded: Incredible insights, Dr. Negi! Your dedication to empowering pre-service teachers is truly inspiring. Excited to see the continued impact!

postsData.name:
Garett Moreau 🇺🇸
Garett Moreau 🇺🇸
postsData.content:
Three Russian GRU officers are sanctioned for carrying out malicious cyber activities against Estonia.

FACT >> This latest breach affected Estonia’s Foreign Affairs, Economic Affairs, and Health Ministries.

CULTURAL CONTEXT >> The capital of Estonia is Tallinn, and produces the finest vodka in the world (Turi), which is currently banned in the United States.

WHY IT MATTERS >> Since experiencing significant cyberattacks in 2007, Estonia has built up some of the first state-level cyber offensives and has become a leader in cybersecurity.

It also hosts the NATO Cooperative Cyber Defence Centre of Excellence in Tallinn, a city which ironically enough, is considered to be the ‘supermodel capital of the world’ and boast a plethora of top notch modelling agencies.

comments.commentText: This it very accurate (at least the part concerning the vodka).
TY Garett Moreau 🇺🇸

postsData.commentAdded: Impressive resilience from Estonia! Their commitment to cybersecurity sets a strong example for nations facing similar threats. #CyberDefense
